com.mcc.ul
Class DaqDeviceDescriptor

java.lang.Object
  com.mcc.ul.DaqDeviceDescriptor
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class DaqDeviceDescriptor
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

This class provides DAQ device descriptors.
Call getDaqDeviceInventory() to create a reference to physical devices that are attached to or paired with the system.

Call getSupportedDaqDevices() to create a reference to virtual devices. This method is only used to determine which devices are supported by the current version of the UL for Android software, and to explore the capabilities of these devices.

Field Summary
 DaqDeviceInterface devInterface
          The DaqDeviceInterface enumeration indicating the type of interface referenced by the current instance of DaqDeviceInterface.
 java.lang.String devString
          A unique (fully-qualified) name that identifies a specific DAQ device. For a Bluetooth device, this value is the product name with a partial serial number appended. For a USB device, this value is a bus location. For an Ethernet device, this value represents a NetBIOS name. For a virtual device, an empty string is returned.
This value can be used to differentiate between multiple devices of the same product type.
 int productId
          The numeric string indicating the product type.
 java.lang.String productName
          The generic (unqualified) product name, except for Bluetooth devices connected through USB. For these devices, the product name with a "USB-" prefix is returned. For a virtual device an empty string is returned.
 java.lang.String uniqueId
          The numeric string indicating either the serial number (for USB devices, or Bluetooth devices connected through USB), or the MAC address (for Bluetooth devices paired with the system.)  For a virtual device an empty string is returned.
 boolean virtual
          The boolean value that indicates if the descriptor references a virtual or physical device.
 
Method Summary
 java.lang.String toString()
          Returns a fully qualified product name for paired Bluetooth devices, and a generic product name for USB and virtual devices.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait
 

Field Detail

productName

public final java.lang.String productName
The generic (unqualified) product name, except for Bluetooth devices connected through USB. For these devices, the product name with a "USB-" prefix is returned. For a virtual device an empty string is returned.
This value is used to retrieve the product name only, and not to differentiate between devices of the same product type.

productId

public final int productId
The numeric string indicating the product type.

devInterface

public final DaqDeviceInterface devInterface
The DaqDeviceInterface enumeration indicating the type of interface referenced by the current instance of DaqDeviceInterface.

devString

public final java.lang.String devString
A unique (fully-qualified) name that identifies a specific DAQ device. For a Bluetooth device, this value is the product name with a partial serial number appended. For a USB device, this value is a bus location. For an Ethernet device, this value represents a NetBIOS name. For a virtual device, an empty string is returned.
This value can be used to differentiate between multiple devices of the same product type.

uniqueId

public final java.lang.String uniqueId
The numeric string indicating either the serial number (for USB devices, or Bluetooth devices connected through USB), or the MAC address (for Bluetooth devices paired with the system.)  For a virtual device an empty string is returned.
This value is unique to each device, but isn't available for USB devices until after connection.

virtual

public final boolean virtual
The boolean value that indicates if the descriptor references a virtual or physical device. For a virtual device an empty string is returned.

Method Detail

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a fully qualified product name for paired Bluetooth devices, and a generic product name for USB and virtual devices.

toString in class java.lang.Object
